    Direct Known Subclasses:
    TimeField

    public class ComboBox
extends Picker
    A combobox control with support for autocomplete, remote-loading, paging and many other features.

    A ComboBox is like a combination of a traditional HTML text <input> field and a <select> field; the user is able to type freely into the field, and/or pick values from a dropdown selection list. The user can input any value by default, even if it does not appear in the selection list; to prevent free-form values and restrict them to items in the list, set forceSelection to true.

    The selection list's options are populated from any Ext.data.Store, including remote stores. The data items in the store are mapped to each option's displayed text and backing value via the valueField and displayField configurations, respectively.

    f your store is not remote, i.e. it depends only on local data and is loaded up front, you should be sure to set the queryMode to 'local', as this will improve responsiveness for the user.

      When true, this prevents the combo from re-querying (either locally or remotely) when the current query is the same as the previous query.

      • doQuery

        public void doQuery(java.lang.String query)
        Execute a query to filter the dropdown list. Fires the beforequery event prior to performing the query allowing the query action to be canceled if needed.
        Parameters:
        query -

      • doQuery

        public boolean doQuery(java.lang.String query,
              boolean forceAll)
        Execute a query to filter the dropdown list. Fires the beforequery event prior to performing the query allowing the query action to be canceled if needed.
        Parameters:
        query - the query to execute
        forceAll - true to force the query to execute even if there are currently fewer characters in the field than the minimum specified by the minChars config option. It also clears any filter previously saved in the current store (defaults to false)

      • doQuery

        public boolean doQuery(java.lang.String query,
              boolean forceAll,
              boolean rawQuery)
        Execute a query to filter the dropdown list. Fires the beforequery event prior to performing the query allowing the query action to be canceled if needed.
        Parameters:
        query - the query to execute
        forceAll - true to force the query to execute even if there are currently fewer characters in the field than the minimum specified by the minChars config option. It also clears any filter previously saved in the current store (defaults to false)
        rawQuery - , Pass as true if the raw typed value is being used as the query string. This causes the resulting store load to leave the raw value undisturbed.(default to false)

      • expand

        public void expand()
        Expands the dropdown list if it is currently hidden. Fires the 'expand' event on completion.

      • select

        public void select(int index,
          boolean scrollIntoView)
        Select an item in the dropdown list by its numeric index in the list. This function does NOT cause the select event to fire. The store must be loaded and the list expanded for this function to work, otherwise use setValue.
        Parameters:
        index - the zero-based index of the list item to select
        scrollIntoView - false to prevent the dropdown list from autoscrolling to display the selected item if it is not currently in view (defaults to true)

      • selectByValue

        public void selectByValue(java.lang.String value,
                 boolean scrollIntoView)
        Select an item in the dropdown list by its data value. This function does NOT cause the select event to fire. The store must be loaded and the list expanded for this function to work, otherwise use setValue.
        Parameters:
        value - the data value of the item to select
        scrollIntoView - false to prevent the dropdown list from autoscrolling to display the selected item if it is not currently in view (defaults to true)

      • setAllQuery

        public void setAllQuery(java.lang.String allQuery)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        The text query to send to the server to return all records for the list with no filtering (defaults to '')
        Parameters:
        allQuery - the all query string
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - this property cannot be changed after the Component has been rendered

      • setAutoSelect

        public void setAutoSelect(boolean value)
        true to automatically highlight the first result gathered by the data store in the dropdown list when it is opened. A false value would cause nothing in the list to be highlighted automatically, so the user would have to manually highlight an item before pressing the enter or tab key to select it (unless the value of (typeAhead) were true), or use the mouse to select a value.

        Defaults to: true

      • setDelimiter

        public void setDelimiter(java.lang.String value)
        The character(s) used to separate the display values of multiple selected items when multiSelect = true.

        Defaults to: ', '

      • setDisplayField

        public void setDisplayField(java.lang.String displayField)
                     throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        The underlying data field name to bind to this ComboBox (defaults to undefined).
        Parameters:
        displayField - the display field
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - this property cannot be changed after the Component has been rendered

      • setEnableRegEx

        public void setEnableRegEx(boolean value)
        When queryMode is 'local' only

        Set to true to have the ComboBox use the typed value as a RegExp source to filter the store to get possible matches.

        Parameters:
        value -

      • setFieldSubTpl

        public void setFieldSubTpl(XTemplate value)
        The content of the field body is defined by this config option.

      • setGrowToLongestValue

        public void setGrowToLongestValue(boolean value)
        false to not allow the component to resize itself when its data changes (and its grow property is true)

        Defaults to: true

      • setMultiSelect

        public void setMultiSelect(boolean value)
        If set to true, allows the combo field to hold more than one value at a time, and allows selecting multiple items from the dropdown list. The combo's text field will show all selected values separated by the delimiter.

        Defaults to: false

      • setQueryCaching

        public void setQueryCaching(boolean value)
        When true, this prevents the combo from re-querying (either locally or remotely) when the current query is the same as the previous query.

        Defaults to: true

      • setQueryMode

        public void setQueryMode(ComboBox.Mode value)
        The mode in which the ComboBox uses the configured Store. Acceptable values are remote and local

      • setQueryMode

        public void setQueryMode(java.lang.String value)
        The mode in which the ComboBox uses the configured Store. Acceptable values are remote and local

      • setTransform

        public void setTransform(java.lang.String value)
        The id, DOM node or Ext.Element of an existing HTML element to convert into a ComboBox. The target select's options will be used to build the options in the ComboBox dropdown; a configured store will take precedence over this.

      • setSelectOnTab

        public void setSelectOnTab(boolean value)
        Whether the Tab key should select the currently highlighted item.

        Defaults to: true

        Overrides:
        setEditable in class TriggerField
        Parameters:
        editable - false to disable editing

      • setForceSelection

        public void setForceSelection(boolean forceSelection)
                       throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        True to restrict the selected value to one of the values in the list, false to allow the user to set arbitrary text into the field (defaults to false)
        Parameters:
        forceSelection - true to force selection
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - this property cannot be changed after the Component has been rendered

                     throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        The height in pixels of the dropdown list resize handle if resizable = true (defaults to 8)
        Parameters:

      • setTpl

        public void setTpl(Template template)
            throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Set the template to use to render the ComboBox items. Used to customize dispaly of ComboBox items.

        For example the template below uses the fields 'url' and 'text' from the Store's RecordDef.

        setTpl(new Template("<div class=\"x-combo-list-item\">" + "<em>{url}</em><strong>{text}</strong>" + "<div class=\"x-clear\"></div></div>"));
        Overrides:
        setTpl in class Component
        Parameters:
        template - template to use for rendering items.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - this property cannot be changed after the Component has been rendered
        See Also:
        Store

      • setValueField

        Parameters:

      • setValueNotFoundText

        public void setValueNotFoundText(java.lang.String valueNotFoundText)
        When using a name/value combo, if the value passed to setValue is not found in the store, valueNotFoundText will be displayed as the field text if defined (defaults to undefined).
        Parameters:
        valueNotFoundText - text when value not found
